record.field: 1. According to The Educational Institute of the American Hotel and Motel Association, the Tourism Industry can be classified into 5 major categories. The tourism industry that is included in the Lodging Operation category is _____
A. Hotels, Motels, Pensions, Lodging Properties
B. Gift Shops, Souvenir Shops, Art/CraftsShops, ShoppingMalls
C. Hotels, Motels, Pensions, Resorts Hotels
2. According to SK Menparpostel no.KM 37/PW.340/MPPT-86 concerning business regulations and hotel management, which essence of the statement is most appropriate?
A. Use part or all of the building to provide lodging, food and beverage services and other supporting services for the public that are managed commercially.
B. The (physical) building that provides room service, food and beverages to guests.
C. Commercially managed buildings, food and beverage services, room service, luggage services, washing clothes and can use the facilities/equipment and enjoy the decorations inside.
D. Commercially managed buildings, food and beverage services, room service, luggage services, laundry.
E. Commercially managed buildings, food and beverage services, room service, other supporting services
3. One of the facilities that can be used by guests to relax or wait for colleagues (business partners) which are generally located at the front of the hotel is known as _____

4. The hospitality industry has unique characteristics that differentiate it from other business fields or industries. One of the differences between hotels and other businesses or industries is _____
A. The hotel industry requires large business capital with a small workforce
B. Influenced by circumstances and changes that occur in the economic, political, social, cultural and security sectors where the hotel is located.
C. Producing and marketing its products does not coincide with the place where the services are produced.
D. Operates 24 hours a day in service to hotel customers and the public in general and closes on holidays
E. Treating customers like friends as well as treating customers as partners in business
5. Friendliness of hotel staff, comfort in guest rooms, beauty and safety of the hotel environment are characteristics of the hospitality industry which can be grouped into _____

6. Hotels that have no ownership or management relationship are not affiliated with another company, usually small and medium-sized hotels owned by families and managed without following certain procedures or operations from other people are grouped into _____

7. Management Contract, namely hotels that separate ownership from management. The hotel owner buys management services from another company by paying a sum of money in accordance with the previous agreement, one of the hotels in Surabaya that is included in the Management Contract category is _____
8. One of the airlines in Indonesia is Garuda Indonesia, in the tourism industry Garuda Indonesia can be classified into _____

9. One of the tourist attractions in East Java Province is Mount Bromo, apart from its natural beauty in the Mount Bromo area there are also cultural events that both domestic and foreign tourists want to witness, known as the _____ ceremony

10. Arranging equipment, maintaining cleanliness, so that the hotel looks neat, clean, attractive and pleasant as well as carrying out room preparations which include equipment, tidiness, cleanliness and comfort to ensure maximum service provided to guests are the duties and responsibilities of the _____ department

11. Carrying out repairs and maintenance of equipment in rooms and other equipment, machines, computers, audio-visual, air conditioners and other electronic devices throughout the hotel is the responsibility of the _____ department

12. Operationally, the hotel service area can be divided into two major groups, namely the front of the house area and the back of the house area. Included in the front of the house area include _____
C. Reception, reservation dan Income Audit
D. Reception, reservation dan Uniformed Service
E. Reception, reservation dan Training & Development
A. Doing work according to health rules
B. Controlling the occurrence of hazards or complications
C. A disease prevention effort that focuses on human environmental health activities
D. Evaluate the level of hazard in the workplace
E. The process of creating something clean, free of physical impurities and pleasing in appearance
A. The process of creating something clean, free of physical impurities and pleasing in appearance
B. A disease prevention that focuses on individual or human health efforts and the environment in which the person is located
C. Doing work according to health rules
D. Prevent the emergence of infectious diseases
E. Evaluate the level of hazard in the workplace
15. The most common cause of work accidents is _____
A. Due to the type of hazard posed by the use of the equipment
B. Read the packaging label and follow the directions
C. Waste sites must be maintained and handled in a safe condition
E. Evaluate the level of hazard in the workplace
16. Which is not a principle of prevention that results in a fire from the use of equipment is _____
A. Do not use equipment that you have not been trained to use
B. Check equipment before and after use
C. Know the types of hazards posed by the use of equipment
E. Avoid damage to the equipment cable
17. The fire extinguisher in the guest room is _____
18. One of the protective equipment used to clean the bathroom is _____
19. Sanitation, hygiene and work safety tools for cleaning glass in high-rise buildings are as follows, except _____
20. First aid procedures for an accident are _____
A. Providing immediate assistance to sick people or accident victims who require basic medical treatment to prevent disability or death
B. Evaluate the level of hazard in the workplace
C. Doing work according to health rules
D. A disease prevention that focuses on individual or human health efforts and the environment in which the person is located
E. A disease prevention effort that focuses on human environmental health activities
21. One example of the application of sanitation, hygiene and work safety is _____
A. Always keep yourself and the environment clean
B. Evaluate the level of hazard in the workplace
C. Know the types of hazards posed by the use of equipment
D. Doing work according to health rules
E. Perform periodic maintenance on equipment
22. Things that need to be done to maintain cleanliness and personal appearance/personal hygiene are _____
A. Always keep yourself and the environment clean
B. Doing work according to health rules
C. Evaluate the level of hazard in the workplace
E. Wear clean and slippery clothes
23. Application of first aid in an accident, one of the actions that can be taken is _____
A. Ensure the safety of helpers, sufferers, and people around the scene
D. Doing work according to health rules
E. Evaluate the level of hazard in the workplace
24. The procedure for implementing fire evaluation from the use of equipment is _____
A. Doing work according to health rules
B. Check equipment before and after use
C. Evaluate the level of hazard in the workplace
D. Always keep yourself and the environment clean
E. Ensure the safety of helpers, sufferers, and people around the scene
25. What is not a safe work procedure is _____
A. Anticipate the existence of factors that cause hazard and take precautions beforehand.
B. Understand the types of hazards that exist in the workplace
C. Evaluate the level of hazard in the workplace
D. Controlling the occurrence of hazards or complications.
E. Ensure the safety of helpers, sufferers, and people around the scene
26. Which of the following hotel employees are responsible for balancing the guest accounts every day?
27. Which of the following is true regarding the Central Reservation System?
A. Has a delay in the interface that allows for overbooking to occur
B. Can have access to the inventory of room availability of each hotel in the chain
C. Allows only the host hotel to access the system for confirmed reservations
28. Guest surveys consistently rank which of the following as the number one concern in hotels?
A. Guest surveys consistently rank which of the following as the number one concern in hotels?
B. Room is ready and available when checking in
29. The primary function of a hotel is to provide lodging accommodation
30. The front office manager’s main function is to ensure that the housekeeping department maintains a high quality of cleaned rooms
